intro: Verbascum phlomoides var. flavum, commonly known as the yellow flax or golden mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, velvety leaves that are often covered in soft, downy hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. This variety is closely related to other members of the Scrophulariaceae family, sharing similar growth habits and floral structures.
